definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: He kept in contact with her, if only very tenuously and intermittently.
sentences.chinese: 他同她保持着聯繫，儘管只是微弱的時斷時續的聯繫。

sentences.english: Bogey 's voice is breaking. When he speaks he rushes up and down the scale.
sentences.chinese: 伯格的聲音時斷時續，他邊說話邊在臺階上來回奔跑。

sentences.english: Officials say some detainees go on and off hunger strike from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 美國官方說，一些在押人員時斷時續地進行絕食。

sentences.english: The voice intermittence , then I realize that it's honking.
sentences.chinese: 聲音時斷時續，我意識到那是雁鳴聲。

sentences.english: This intermittent rain tears, how no one end?
sentences.chinese: 這時斷時續的雨淚，怎麼就沒個止境？

sentences.english: The dog's continual barking disturbed the whole neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 時斷時續的狗叫攪得整個街道不得安寧。
